tool.name: Minia
tool.description: Short-read assembler based on a de Bruijn graph
tool.command:
#set input = 'infile.' + $in.ext ln -s '$in' '$input' &&
minia -in '$input' -kmer-size $kmer_size #if str($abundance_min): -abundance-min $abundance_min #end if #if str($abundance_max): -abundance-min $abundance_max #end if -nb-cores \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1} -out output

param.label: Reads in FASTA or FASTQ format
Min abundance threshold for solid kmers (default: 2)
Max abundance threshold for solid kmers

tool.help: Minia is a short-read assembler based on a de Bruijn graph, capable of assembling a human genome on a desktop computer in a day. The output of Minia is a set of contigs.
